channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Three English nationals are investigated over the death of British woman killed by a speedboat
item.description: British woman Claire Glatman, 60, was killed when she was hit by a speedboat while swimming in the sea off Avlaki beach, Corfu yesterday. Her body was discovered by another bather at around 10am.

item.title: Man draws a race track on his drive for the bike-riding boy who keeps veering into his driveway
item.description: Dave Phoxe, from Salt Lake City in Utah, kept getting alerts every time a boy veered into his driveway on his balance bike during daily walks with his family.

item.title: Gavin Williamson: GCSE and A-level exams could be delayed
item.description: The Education Secretary's comments come after Labour called for a delay to next year´s exams.He said exams regulator Ofqual would consider a 'short delay'
item.media:description: Secretary of State for Education Gavin Williamson in his office at the Department of Education in Westminster (Stefan Rousseau/PA)

item.title: Majority of schoolchildren in England and Wales return to classes for first time in six months today
item.description: Labour supporter Adam Woodward, 23, who is starting teaching at Horizon Community College in Barnsley, South Yorkshire, tweeted: 'I am scared and so are the students.'

item.title: Ocado customers rejoice after receiving their first delivery of M&S food as £750m deal launches
item.description: Many loyal Ocado customers in the UK were less than impressed after receiving notifications late last night that their shopping deliveries had been cancelled hours before they were due.

item.title: London's roads clog up today as commuters head back to the office
item.description: Britain's rush hour started to get back to normal again today as the return to work following the coronavirus lockdown was stepped up - with more than 370 jams totalling 200 miles across London during rush hour.

item.title: Man, 42, dies after falling off paddle board and getting tangled in moorings
item.description: The 42-year-old man fell into the water near the sailing club at Rock beach in Cornwall.

item.title: Ben Wallace stops to SHAKE HANDS on way into Cabinet
item.description: Ben Wallace appeared to forget social distancing rules as he warmly greeted a colleague on the way into the Foreign Office - where the session is being held so ministers have more space.

item.title: Ed Sheeran and wife Cherry Seaborn announce the birth of daughter
item.description: The singer took to Instagram on Tuesday morning, sharing a picture of Lyra's booties and a colourful blanket.

item.title: Two-year-old with a $20,000 designer wardrobe packed with pieces from Gucci, Versace and Givenchy
item.description: Anita Felix, from Yorba Linda, California, has accumulated more than 12,000 followers on Instagram because of the daily snaps shared by her mother Stella who loves to buy designer clothes.

item.title: All Creatures Great and Small starts tonight on Channel 5
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL during a Q&A ahead of the new series, which starts tonight on Channel 5, star Samuel West said that it's a relief to be in a drama series that's not about 'very rich people'.

item.title: Cargo ship collides with Ministry of Defence vessel
item.description: Officers were called to Falmouth at around 8am where a cargo ship crashed into a Ministry of Defence vessel, the 'Smit Yare' (file picture).

item.title: Driver infuriated by 's****y cycle lane' knocks down bollards - but wrecks his wing mirror
item.description: The clip, shared by Jeremy Vine, shows a driver ploughing through bollards marking out a cycle lane, believed to be in Brighton. The driver laughs as he says he's given it a 'proper little battering'.

item.title: Dozens more migrants including women and children make dangerous Channel crossing
item.description: The group are the first migrants to arrive in the UK from France since last Thursday after windy weather prevented the treacherous 21 mile journey across the Straits of Dover in small boats.

item.title: BBC's director-general Tim Davie arrives for first day as he threatens to AXE 'left-wing' comedies
item.description: New BBC director geenral time Davie wants an overhaul of its comedy output in the coming months, over fears it is seen as is seen as 'too one-sided', reports the Telegraph.

item.title: Pictured: Dutch man, 38, who was dragged from his tent by a polar bear and mauled to death
item.description: Johan Jacobus Kootte was killed during the night while he was lying in his tent in a camping area near the town Longyearbyen, on the island of Svalbard.

item.title: Eight-week-old baby who went viral after saying hello appears on This Morning
item.description: Eight week-old Charlie-John Taylor-Mullington, Cheshire, has appeared on This Morning with his parents, who admit he's not been speaking since his viral moment and that it was a 'one-off thing'.

item.title: Boris Johnson warns 'there is more wretched Covid still to come'
item.description: The Prime Minister told his top team that 'we know there will be more outbreaks' but he is 'absolutely confident' the Government will be able to deal with them.

item.title: Wayne Rooney's neighbours apply to keep 1,000 SHEEP next door to his £20million Cheshire mansion
item.description: Brighouse Farms, next door to the ex-England footballer's new home near Knutsford in Cheshire, has revealed plans for two sheds with a combined floor size of 1,886 sq m.

item.title: 'Sexual communication' is key to a good relationship, study shows
item.description: Researchers surveyed 126 young, early stage couples about their sex life, including how often they had sex, and their levels of both sexual satisfaction and general satisfaction with their relationship.

item.title: Mum shares clever trick for disposing of 'hot grease' without spilling a drop down the drain
item.description: Australians need never block kitchen sinks with grease again thanks to this handy trick, which requires nothing but tinfoil and a small bit of patience.

item.title: Fearless tourist grabs a tiger's testicles as she poses for a photo at Thai zoo
item.description: The tourist, who was visiting the Tiger Kingdom zoo in Chiang Mai, northern Thailand, posed for selfies with the animal before fearlessly reaching between its legs and cupping its testicles.

item.title: Paedophiles are using cheese and pizza emojis to communicate secretly on Instagram
item.description: The emojis have been used to identify thousands of potential paedophile accounts on social media that are accessing explicit images of children. More than 2,000 have already been shut down.

item.title: AstraZeneca begins final trials of Oxford University coronavirus vaccine enrolling 50,000 people
item.description: The world may be one step closer to getting a Covid-19 jab after Oxford's candidate entered its final stage of tests in the US. Thousands have already been injected in the UK, Brazil and South Africa.

item.title: Sea of souped-up motors flood Southend seafront as up to 5,000 attend car meet
item.description: Police went to the Essex town to break up the gathering, which was illegal due to coronavirus restrictions preventing groups of more than 30 meeting together with the threat of a £10,000 fine.

item.title: Dog bears uncanny resemblance...to a bear! Owner's Leonberger is mistaken for a wild animal on walks
item.description: Gentle giant Runny, a one-year-old Leonberger, often stops shocked passersby in their tracks when she's on a stroll with owner Marit Lillejordet in the forests of Oslo, Norway.

item.title: France's Charlie Hebdo magazine will REPUBLISH Mohammed cartoons for start of terror trial
item.description: Twelve people, including some of France's most celebrated cartoonists, were killed on January 7, 2015, when brothers Said and Cherif Kouachi went on a gun rampage at the paper's offices in Paris.

item.title: Maverick No10 aide Dominic Cummings swaps joggers for a SUIT on first day back
item.description: Dominic Cummings - who took time off for an undisclosed medical operation recently - donned a smart suit for the first Cabinet meeting called by Boris Johnson after the summer holidays.

item.title: Bank of Mum and Dad gets busy raising deposits for young home buyers
item.description: Almost one in four purchases this year will be backed by parents, family and friends, according to a survey by insurance giant Legal & General and the Cebr.

item.title: Michel Barnier and UK's David Frost hold crucial trade talks
item.description: EU negotiator Michel Barnier is coming to London for the meeting as the hunt for a breakthrough becomes increasingly desperate.

item.title: Most people 'won't get the flu jab until DECEMBER'
item.description: The Government is organising the biggest ever flu vaccination programme for the UK this year but those aged 50-64 years won't get their jab until December, leaked documents reveal.

item.title: Glacial lake volume has surged by 50 per cent in just 30 years
item.description: Researchers tracked glacial lake volume since 1990 using more than a quarter of a million satellite images to create a 'near-global database' of glacial lakes,

item.title: Simon Case, 41, is confirmed as youngest head of civil service in living memory
item.description: Boris Johnson said Simon Case, drafted in to be the top aide at Number 10 earlier this year, would do a 'fantastic' job as Cabinet Secretary.

item.title: Children spread the coronavirus 'six times less than adults'
item.description: Researchers studied 1,900 people, mostly children, at summer camps in Spain over five weeks. Children had an R rate of 0.3 which was six times lower than in the general population, which was 1.7-2.

item.title: Trump campaign hits back after Twitter raises flag for using clip of Joe Biden speech out of context
item.description: One of the Trump campaign's tweets has been flagged as 'manipulated' with a blue exclamation mark by Twitter after they posted a clip of election rival Joe Biden out of context.

item.title: Great British Bake Off FIRST LOOK: Show releases new topical trailer set in the height of lockdown
item.description: The trailer sees the nation frantically searching for the key baking staple as a young boy cycles to his grandmother's house to deliver the precious ingredient.

item.title: Girl, 15, killed in front of her family in speedboat crash suffered catastrophic chest injury
item.description: Emily Lewis and her family were among 12 people enjoying a 'sightseeing trip' on the high speed rigid inflatable boat (RIB) when it smashed into a navigation buoy during choppy conditions.

item.title: University Challenge contestant with broken glasses 'accepting donations' for new specs
item.description: Student Tom Sherlock, from Hertfordshire, who uses the 'they/them' pronoun, appeared on the BBC2 show wearing a pair of clear, round-framed specs that had seen better days.

item.title: Girl, four, is lured into a car and abducted at a petrol station in Ukraine
item.description: CCTV footage from a petrol station in the city of Boryspil, Ukraine shows a man dressed all in black jeans ushering the four-year-old girl into the back of a white car as her mother pays for fuel.

item.title: Melting of ice sheets could add up to 16 inches to global oceans by 2100
item.description: Mass loss from 2007 to 2017 due to melt-water and crumbling ice matched Intergovernmental Panel for Climate Change's (IPCC) most extreme forecasts.

item.title: Girl, 11, with childhood dementia left without eyesight, speech, memory or the ability to move
item.description: Molly Ingham, 11, from Stalybridge, Cheshire, was diagnosed with Batten disease - a rare form of genetic childhood dementia - with sufferers unlikely to make it to adulthood.

item.title: Furious Piers Morgan clashes with conspiracy theorist Piers Corbyn on GMB
item.description: Piers Corbyn claimed the UK was the subject of a 'psychological operation to close down the economy in the interest of mega corporations', who, he says, will see a 'massive gain' out of joblessness.

item.title: How losing weight can help men gain a centimetre
item.description: PROFESSOR DR PIET HOEBEKE: Men sometimes get into a panic about their penis even though there is actually nothing wrong with it. So what is normal?

item.title: Samantha Cameron says she and David did not 'get on very well' after he resigned as Prime Minister
item.description: Samantha Cameron, 49, who lives in Oxfordshire, appeared on the Happy Mum, Happy Baby podcast and discussed a rough period in her marriage with the former Prime Minister David, 53.

item.title: Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford to spearhead new child food poverty task force
item.description: Along with Aldi, Asda, Co-op, Deliveroo, FareShare, Food Foundation, Iceland, Kellogg's, Lidl, Sainsbury's, Tesco and Waitrose, Rashford has formed the 'Child Food Poverty Task Force'.

item.title: Hungary closes its borders to foreigners in bid to halt spread of Covid-19
item.description: Cars were queuing at the border with Austria last night (pictured) as Hungary re-imposed the measures that were in force during the first wave of the pandemic.

item.title: Princess Diana's brother Charles Spencer shares touching tributes as he marks the date of her death
item.description: Earl Spencer, 55, who lives in Northamptonshire, shared several tributes to Princess Diana yesterday online as he marked the 23rd anniversary of her death.

item.title: Apple is preparing 75 million of its new 5G iPhones for release
item.description: The initial figures are in line with previous iPhone launches, suggesting Apple doesn't think consumer interest is waning due to the coronavirus pandemic and economic slowdown.

item.title: Millions of Wuhan school pupils return to the classroom in the former COVID-19 epicentre
item.description: As many as 2,842 educational institutions across the former coronavirus epicentre are welcoming almost 1.4 million pupils back to the campus as the autumn semester starts.

item.title: Parrot entertains wildlife park visitors with a perfect rendition of Beyonce hit If I Were A Boy
item.description: Crowds are defying social distancing measures at Lincolnshire Wildlife Park to get a glimpse of Chico, a nine-year-old yellow-crowned amazon parrot.

item.title: Laa-Laa Land: Gary Neville slashes £650,000 price of plot for £8m 'Teletubbies' eco-home
item.description: Sky Sports pundit Gary Neville has slashed the £650,000 price of his 'Teletubbies' eco-house plot by a quarter, due to lack of interest. Neville, 45, came up with his £8million plan a decade ago

item.title: Tesco security guard hurls 'shoplifter' out of shop after hitting him around the head in London
item.description: Other shoppers filmed the moment the man was beaten up at a Tesco Express branch on Blackfriars Road in Elephant and Castle, London, on Sunday evening.

item.title: Couple get married for £300 - with a £10 eBay dress and Rishi-discounted Brewers Fayre dinner
item.description: Childhood sweethearts Chelsea-Marie and Hayden Davies, both 25, from Glastonbury, Somerset, did their wedding on a budget after Covid-19 disrupted plans for a bigger celebration.

item.title: 'Fake' Rembrandt painting will return to wall of Oxford museum
item.description: Head of a Bearded Man (c. 1630) was bequeathed to the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford by British art dealer Percy Moore Turner in 1951 and entered the collection as an early Rembrandt.

item.title: North Korea orders soldiers and police to 'shoot on sight' anyone within half a mile of the border
item.description: Police in the city of Hoeryong said they would kill anyone within such a distance of the boundary 'regardless of their reason for being there', RFA reports.

item.title: Picture of 'upskirting' suspect after teenager spotted him behind her with lens sticking out of bag
item.description: Police have released this photo of an 'upskirting' suspect after teenager spotted a man behind her with lens sticking out of his bag. It happened in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire.

item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero who saved 1,200 lives during country's 1994 genocide is arrested on terror charges
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, 66, who was portrayed as a hero in the film, has been arrested by the Rwandan government on terror charges, police announced on Monday. He has not been charged in court yet.

item.title: Donald Trump compares cops who shoot civilians in the back to golfers who choke and miss putts
item.description: 'They choke, just like in a golf tournament, they miss a 3-foot putt', Trump said in an interview broadcast Monday, main. He had been discussing the police shooting of black man Jacob Blake.

item.title: How virus-proof is your mask? Under laboratory conditions, a professor answers the burning question
item.description: Face coverings may be compulsory in more places now than ever - but how much protection do they really afford to people around you? Professor Val Edwards-Jones is pictured above testing masks.

item.title: Holiday HELL for up to 75,000 Britons with Portugal on brink of going BACK on UK quarantine list
item.description: The cheapest Ryanair flight from Lisbon to London airports was £302 today before dipping to £291 tomorrow and returning to £302 on Thursday.

item.title: Social media users share hilarious memes as millions of pupils return to the classroom
item.description: Many children in England are giddy with excitement to be reunited with their classmates for the first time since March, when schools shut as the pandemic gathered pace.

item.title: Lockdown's legacy on UK's poorest children: Richer pupils 46% further ahead than worse-off peers
item.description: A poll of nearly 3,000 school leaders and teachers has laid bare the devastating impact lockdown has had on Britain's children, with the poorest and boys worst affected.

item.title: Parrot admires its reflection in Australian traffic camera
item.description: The curious corella bird started pecking on the camera lens on a gantry above the highway in Western Australia last week.

item.title: In plane view! People reveal the most bizarre sights they've seen at airports
item.description: Passengers at airports across the globe are often deliriously tired - and great sources of entertainment! Too Cool 2 Be True has compiled snaps of some of the funniest things people have witnessed.

item.title: Pilot in fatal helicopter crash says his 'world ended' when it ditched and killed four passengers
item.description: The pilot of a helicopter that crashed killing four people has revealed his 'world ended' after the accident. Sarah Darnley, Gary McCrossan, Duncan Munro and George Allison all died in the incident

item.title: MasterChef critic William Sitwell's 300-year-old family mansion goes on sale for £3.25million
item.description: EXCLUSIVE:The Sitwells were once among the most celebrated of British society families, with their Northamptonshire manor, Weston Hall, proving to be the perfect place to host glamorous parties.

item.title: Staff member at The Yorkshire Job Centre fears funding lifestyle of drug users
item.description: Pip, from Leeds, works for the Social Justice team at the Southern House Job Centre and appeared on the Channel 4 programme on Tuesday night as she sought to help ex-addict Wayne, 40.

item.title: Leeds and Reading Festival 2021: Headline acts confirmed
item.description: Leeds and Reading Festival confirmed to return in 2021 with a host of big names performing including Liam Gallagher, Stormzy, Post Malone, Lewis Capaldi, Disclosure and more.

item.title: Blue light from a computer or phone can age the skin as badly as the midday Sun
item.description: Scientists working for Unilever examined the effects of 'blue light' emitted by electronic devices on the skin and found it can cause premature ageing.

item.title: Baby born deaf hears mother's and father's voices for first time after having hearing aids fitted
item.description: Tiffany Wroe, 29, who is from Manchester but has lived in Nairobi, Kenya, for the past 10 years with her husband John, 44, shared the video of 11-week-old Saul on Facebook.

item.title: Tatler's guide to Covid-compliant etiquette
item.description: The society bible listed shopping at Ocado, having a dirty kitchen, and hot tubs on skiing trips as out, while being chaste, having live-in staff and holidaying in the British Isles will mark you out as posh.

item.title: Prince George, 7, watches dad William on Balmoral grouse shoot
item.description: The seven-year-old watched as Prince William, 38, and other senior royals spent the morning bagging birds in Corgarff, a short drive from Balmoral, on Saturday. (George is pictured in July)

item.title: Queen suffered OCD as a child and lined up pencils to feel 'safe', new book claims
item.description: A new book has made the extraordinary claim that Queen Elizabeth II showed signs of obsessive compulsive disorder as a child by straightening pencils in order to feel 'safe'.

item.title: Prince Harry is 'upset' at missing trip to Balmoral to see the Queen because of coronavirus
item.description: Prince Harry is said to be 'upset' on missing out on the annual family gathering in Balmoral, due to the coronavirus restrictions. Meghan Markle is reportedly 'too busy' to feel sad about it.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'is considering raising fuel duty by as much as 5p' to pay nation's Covid bill
item.description: The Chancellor is looking at axing a ten year freeze on fuel duty in his autumn Budget, which would see prices at the pumps rise by 2p immediately in line with inflation.

item.title: Britain braced for Storm Gavin as Met Office unveils names for upcoming extreme weather
item.description: England saw the coldest start to an August Bank Holiday Monday in nearly 40 years, with most places struggling to reach temperatures in the high teens despite widespread sunshine.

item.title: Children are at a greater risk from MEASLES than Covid says Britain's most senior paediatrician
item.description: Professor Russell Viner advised parents to send their children back to school, claiming he's 'far more worried about the risk to children of measles than of Covid'.

item.title: Is this Wales's dumbest dog? Spaniel chases a flock of seagulls half a MILE out to sea
item.description: The dog ran away from its owner and into the sea off the coast of Rhyl, Wales, just before 9am on Monday morning.

item.title: Bank Holiday Fun-day! Revellers enjoy last hurrah on final night of three-day weekend
item.description: Young men and women across Britain went out for a night on the tiles on the final August weekend, with some even sporting patterned face masks.

item.title: Facebook threatens to stop users sharing news in Australia
item.description: Australia's world-first law would force Facebook and Google to negotiate fees with the news companies whose stories appear on their websites - with fines of millions of dollars if they fail to comply.

item.title: Protesters gather in LA after cops shoot and kill a black man in a hail of bullets
item.description: The man, identified by family members as Dijon Kizzee, was shot dead by police at around 3pm shortly after police tried to stop him for a vehicle violation on his bicycle, before dropping a gun.

item.title: Men make harrowing confessions about first sexual encounters while posing nude for new documentary
item.description: The programme, which aired last night and showed an erect penis in what is believed to be a UK broadcasting first, explores the taboo which surrounds the phallus and explored masculinity.

item.title: Tricky trivia quiz challenges your general knowledge with 20 multiple choice questions
item.description: A fun new quiz from US-trivia site Playbuzz challenges your knowledge on a range of subjects from geography to literature - and many have struggled to achieve a perfect score.

item.title: Are YOU getting the right pills to help beat crippling gout?
item.description: For seven years, Sue McDonagh struggled with gout attacks so intense, it felt as though shards of glass were pressing into her right big toe, and at one point had her begging for an amputation.

item.title: Americans are fleeing New York and New Jersey in search of remote pastures in Vermont and Idaho
item.description: New York and New Jersey, have seen a large proportion of residents relocate to Florida, Texas and other Sunbelt states since March, because of an increase in fear of living in densely populated areas

item.title: Mother who lost son to brain tumour dealt 'hammer blow' after his twin's leukaemia diagnosis
item.description: Coming shortly after his identical twin brother Ben's death, Jack Parton's leukaemia diagnosis was a 'hammer blow' to his family, his mother Julie Parton told the Birminghan Mail.

item.title: A pack of 20 cigarettes in Australia now costs £19 after latest tax hike
item.description: Popular brands are even more expensive, with smokers having to pay north of £22 from today, as the Government's tobacco excise increases for the second time this year by 12.5 per cent.

item.title: Davina McCall, 52, says she still enjoys orgasms and feels like 'a foxy minx'
item.description: The presenter - who is mum to three children, Holly, 18, Tilly, 16 and Chester, 13, from her former marriage - also opened up about the 'story behind the sadness' of her post-divorce weight loss

item.title: Boris Johnson took part in training course on sexual harassment and bullying, No 10 confirms
item.description: The Prime Minister listened to the two-hour online course along with other MPs and peers on Thursday. One participant told Sky News: 'I was quite surprised to see the Prime Minister taking part'.

item.title: UK businesses will foot 10% of the wages of up to 10 million furloughed staff from today
item.description: Business leaders warn of further lay-offs across Britain as the Government reduces its contribution to 70 per cent of wages up to £2,500 per month, down from 80 per cent.

item.title: Donald Trump says they are investigating plane 'full of thugs in black uniforms' heading to the RNC
item.description: Donald Trump appeared on Fox News on Monday night to claim that 'a plane full of thugs' with 'gear' boarded a flight to Washington DC intent on causing chaos at the RNC. He would not give details.

item.title: When tiredness is a sign you're having a SILENT heart attack
item.description: ANGELA EPSTEIN: Hollywood may have us believe heart attacks involve dramatic chest pain. Yet many can be overlooked - vague symptoms dismissed as a virus or fatigue.

item.title: Grandmother, 71, in tears after finally receiving diagnosis for unexplained condition
item.description: Judy, 71, from Kent, appeared on BBC2 show The Diagnosis Detectives, where she received a diagnosis for an unexplained condition for over ten years and left her 'skin and bones'.

item.title: NHS enrolls 5,000 patients in mass trial of its soups and shakes diet to REVERSE diabetes
item.description: The volunteers in England will be restricted to restricted to just 810 calories per day - a third of an adult man's recommended daily intake and almost half of a woman's.

item.title: Memo to the BBC's new boss: If it doesn't serve Britain, I fear it won't survive, writes ROGER MOSEY
item.description: ROGER MOSEY: Any idea that Tim Davie might enjoy a honeymoon period as the BBC's new director-general has gone up in smoke.

item.title: Eat Out to Help Out scheme is set to smash 80million-meal barrier tonight at £400m cost to taxpayer
item.description: Diners have endured three hour queues for their final 50% discounts of up to £10 per head which have been offered at restaurants across the country since the beginning of August.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Rishi Sunak's coronarivus debt
item.description: 'People are going to find Rishi's tax rises a lot harder to swallow'

item.title: Jockey Club chief executive lost her job 'after sharing a meme about Susan Boyle'
item.description: Delia Bushell, 48, tendered her resignation on Sunday after independent barrister Jack Mitchell found evidence to support a number of the allegations of misconduct against her - including racist comments.

item.title: Lone Channel swimmer is found by passing vessel after eight-hour search
item.description: A helicopter and rescue teams were dispatched to the sea off Kent after the coastguard received a call from a member of the public saying a friend was trying to cross to France.

item.title: 'He probably would have been killed.' Donald Trump DEFENDS accused double murderer Kyle Rittenhouse
item.description: President Trump defended the actions of Kyle Rittenhouse, saying the 17-year-old 'probably would have been killed' by an angry mob if he hadn't fired at them with his illegal weapon.

item.title: Kanye West denies rumors Trump and GOP are bankrolling his White House bid
item.description: Kanye West sought to quash speculation that Republicans are paying him to run as a distraction to bolster President Trump's chances at re-election in an interview with Nick Cannon.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: Nothing can beat Chateau Le Silage Pit!
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: Last Thursday in my column, I celebrated an exciting new range of candles called Scents of Normality, designed to evoke the smell of places and events.

item.title: Late eaters are more likely to gain weight, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Ulster University in Northern Ireland surveyed almost 1,200 people and found that those who were later eaters ended up eating more overall and it tended to be less healthy.

item.title: Staff working from home do nearly an extra hour a day as research shows they send more emails
item.description: Ninety percent of staff say they would like to continue working from home, even if that means they have to work longer hours, while 70 percent claim that they're more productive than they are in the office.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'spearheaded online trolling campaign against Amber Heard'
item.description: The documents - which are publicly available online - claim Johnny Depp attempted to 'defame Amber Heard and interfere with her reputation, career and livelihood' through the online trolling campaign.

item.title: New vacuum-powered biopsy could spare thousands of women from major breast cancer surgery
item.description: RACHEL ELLIS: Using 'vacuum' technology to help pinpoint the location of breast cancer left after chemotherapy could spare thousands of women major surgery.

item.title: Fortress dating back to the 12th-century BC found Israel matches a structure described in the Bible
item.description: Archaeologists in Israeli uncovered a massive fortress dating to the 12th-century BC that matches a structure described in the bible, which was built by Canaanites to fend off invading Philistines.

item.title: Schindler's List is nation's favourite film music
item.description: John Williams won an Oscar for his accompaniment to Steven Spielberg's 1993 film, about a German who saved more than 1,000 Jewish people during the Holocaust.

item.title: Canary Island hit by coronavirus second wave of at least 40 new cases
item.description: El Hierro previously registered only a handful of cases and no deaths. But a second wave of the virus has left at least 40 people infected - prompting local authorities to take urgent action.

item.title: The headset that could trick you into losing weight
item.description: The device, worn as a headset, sends electrical signals to the vestibular nerves, which are linked to the parts of the brain that control fat storage and hunger.

item.title: Heaven scent? New research reveals how armpit aroma can be cue for passion
item.description: Researchers from Kent University found men are able to detect subtle changes in the armpit aroma of females who are aroused.

item.title: Give all our youngsters a chance to study again, writes Professor CARL HENEGHAN
item.description: CARL HENEGHAN: The most powerful tool for better health is education. To get our country off its sickbed and functioning again, it is crucial that we fully reopen our schools and our universities.

item.title: Can BA fly high again? Airline burning through £20m of cash every day
item.description: Parent company IAG made a £3.8bn loss in the first half of this year. It is trying to raise just under £2.5bn of capital from shareholders including Qatar Airways, which owns 25 per cent.

item.title: Wallaby is hit by a car, becomes trapped in the grille and travels 304km stuck inside - but survives
item.description: The young marsupial was hit by a family in a car in Laura, in Far North Queensland, on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: The time-saving laundry hacks you NEED to know: Mum shares the five things she does for a clean home
item.description: A Melbourne mum shared five time-saving laundry hacks, including tying socks before you wash them so you don't lose one and adding baking soda to the wash to soften your clothes.

item.title: ROY TAYLOR: Our patients felt 10 years younger after losing two stone writes professor
item.description: ROY TAYLOR: For decades, the scourge of type 2 diabetes has caused untold misery. Almost four million Britons are now living with the condition.

item.title: Nadiya Hussain reveals she was racially abused when she used apple in a Cornish pasty recipe
item.description: Former Bake Off winner, Nadiya Hussain, 35, who lives in Milton Keynes, spoke to Radio Times and told how she has experienced more racism in the last five years than in her entire life.

item.title: CAPTAIN TOM MOORE reveals a family joke turned him into a £32m NHS fundraiser
item.description: In a final extract from his charming new book, Captain Tom Moore looks back on how the gentle rehabilitation exercise he took in April turned into a record-breaking fundraising campaign.

item.title: NORMAN LAMONT advises Rishi Sunak on lockdown funding
item.description: NORMAN LAMONT: The job of Chancellor of the Exchequer is always one of the most difficult in Government. Rishi Sunak has faced a bigger challenge than any other modern Chancellor.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Who needs Extinction Rebellion when we've got Grant Shapps?
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Motorists who park on pavements are to be hit with a £70 fine under new rules published by Transport Secretary Grant Shapps.

item.title: Porn actor Ron Jeremy charged with 20 new counts of sex abuse including assault of teen and 12 more
item.description: Adult film performer Ron Jeremy has been charged with sexually assaulting a 15-year-old girl and a dozen more women, Los Angeles prosecutors said Monday.

item.title: Bloomin' heck! Plants can see, hear and CHAT
item.description: Scientists are discovering more all the time about the ability of plants to 'hear', 'talk', 'count', 'remember', spot 'regional accents' and even size up opponents.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Cara Delevingne is left 'devastated' by death of her godmother
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Friends of the effervescent Annette 'Scruff' Howard, Cara Delevingne's godmother, are in mourning today, following her death aged 71.

item.title: Why are patients STILL at risk from stem cell jabs?
item.description: JOHN NAISH: Princess Michael of Kent appeared in a promotional video for a clinic in the Bahamas that offers stem cell therapy for problem joints such as her painful shoulder.

item.title: The coronavirus pandemic has led to a dramatic rise in private planes
item.description: Air Charter Service, the world's largest aircraft charter broker, reports a 93 per cent rise in new customer inquiries. Here, SADIE NICHOLAS speaks to four lucky holidaymakers.

item.title: Man, 27, shot dead sitting in barbershop chair in Colombia
item.description: Carlos Andrés Carmona was killed while at a barbershop in Medellín, Colombia on Saturday. The 31-year-old man is the 29th murder victim this year in the Medellín sector of Girardot.

item.title: Morrison's worker is sacked after calling a shopper a 'black c***'
item.description: The employee hurled racist abuse at the black customer as security held the man back and staff tried to restrain the worker who kept screaming in a store in Palmers Green, London.

item.title: How you can enjoy 48 days off work using just 18 days of annual leave
item.description: Instant Office has revealed how you can beat the system to cash in on almost double the number of days off next year - by extending your annual leave with bank holidays.

item.title: Being selfish doesn't get you ahead even in a dog-eat-dog workplace, study finds
item.description: University of California, Berkeley researchers asked 450 students to fill in personality surveys - then did the same a decade later also examining their career progress.

item.title: Pills to lower blood pressure can prevent heart attacks even in HEALTHY people
item.description: In the biggest study of its kind, Oxford University researchers found lowering levels even from a healthy starting point slashed the risk of heart disease and strokes by up to 13 per cent years down the line.

item.title: Savvy mum shares how she feeds her family of four for just £47 a month
item.description: Mary Bells, from Torquay, Devon, posted a picture to Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK Facebook Group and showed off her impressive array of batch cooked dinners which feed her husband and kids.

item.title: Mother stuns onlookers with uncanny resemblance to Kendall Jenner
item.description: Teona Chachua, 29, from Tbilisi, Georgia, never realised just how much she looked like the reality TV star until she started beauty blogging in 2018, and was inundated by fans of the model.

item.title: Reality stars blasted for promoting 'get-rich-quick' schemes
item.description: One guru promoted by reality stars is Jordan Heyward, 24, of Plymouth, who boasts of having more than 4,000 clients. He has been promoted by Kyle Christie, Scott Timlin, and Thomas Powell.

item.title: Tatler names its hottest Social Set couples of Summer 2020
item.description: Society bible Tatler has named the hottest blue blooded couples of the summer from the British social set, which includes chocolate heiress Jemima Cadbury and Princess Margaret's grandson.

item.title: Greek police treated Harry Maguire 'like just another drunk Brit'
item.description: Appearing on Good Morning Britain, prosecutor Ioannis Paradissis insists police did identify themselves to Harry Maguire, who he claims is now using his fortune to evade responsibility.

item.title: British passenger overpowered by cabin crew on Jet2 flight after he 'hammered on the cockpit door'
item.description: The aircraft was travelling from Dalaman to Manchester airport on Wednesday evening when the crew activated an 'emergency' situation signal just one hour into its journey.
